Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: LKM MSSQL to Oracle (BCP/SQLLDR)
AUTHOR: Oracle
DESCRIPTION - Loading Knowledge Module - Loads data from a Microsoft SQL Server to Oracle database (staging area) using the BCP and SQLLDR utilities. - A view is created on the source server and a temporary table(C$) is created on the target server. - When using this module on a journalized source table, the Journaling table is first updated to flag the records consumed and then cleaned from these records at the end of the interface.
REQUIREMENTS - Required privileges on the target table for the connection user: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE - Required system privileges on the target table for the connection user: DROP ANY TABLE, CREATE ANY TABLE, DROP ANY INDEX, DROP ANY INDEX - Required privileges on the source tables or views for the connection user: SELECT, CREATE VIEW, DROP VIEW - It is mandatory to define an Update Key for the Interface.
BASIC CONFIGURATION - Source Database must be set to 'select into/bulk copy' option. - Check that your interface has an update key defined. - Leave the KM options to their default values.
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - FIELD_SEPARATOR: Field separator for records in BCP output file. - RECORD_SEPARATOR: Record separator (end of a record) in BCP output file. - WORK_TABLE_OPTIONS: Use this option to create the work table in nologging mode. - DEFAULT_DIRECTORY: Directory where temporary files such as data and logs are created. - LOA_DIRECT: Set this option to Yes to turn on Direct-Path Loading by SQLLDR. - LOA_ERRORS: Enter the maximum number of records with errors allowed during loading. - TRAILING_NULLCOLS: Use this option to import empty columns as null columns. - DELETE_TEMPORARY_OBJECTS: Set this option to No to retain temporary objects - UNICODE_SUPPORT: Set this option to Yes to load data (export/import) in Unicode character format. - DATETIME_FORMAT: Map SQL Server datetime data into Oracle TIMESTAMP (> 8i) or DATE (<9i) - BCP_PATH: Use this option to specify system path to BCP - BCP_LOCAL_SERVER: Set this option to Yes to connect to local default instance - SQLLDR_PATH: Use this option to specify system path to SQLLDR. - SQLLDR_CONNECT_ID: Connect identifier for SQLLDR.
LIMITATIONS - ODI Agent must have BCP and SQLLDR available. - $ORACLE_HOME/bin directory needs to be in the path when Agent is started - For performance reasons, it is recommanded to install ODI Agent either on the Source or on the Target Server.
NOTES
1. This LKM does not support loading into LOB objects.
2. Support of SQL Server character datatypes: - Length limitation: this LKM will only support string length up to 4000 (Oracle maximum), even though SQL Server supports string length up to 8000. - Unicode (UTF16) is supported (refer to UNICODE_SUPPORT option).
3. Support of SQL Server Numeric datatypes: - Default decimal separator is comma (will not use -R option for BCP to enable Regional Locale).
4. Support of SQL Server datetime datatypes: - By default SQL Server datetime & smalldatetime data is converted to Oracle TIMESTAMP data - Oracle 8i does not support TIMESTAMP but only DATE, therefore such conversion might result in potential loss of fractional seconds.
5. Suggested SQL Server to Oracle conversion:
- char to CHAR - varchar to VARCHAR2 - varrchar(max) to VARCHAR2 - text to VARCHAR2 - nchar to NCHAR - nvarchar to NVARCHAR2 - nvarcharmax to NVARCHAR2 - ntext to NVARCHAR2 - smallint to NUMBER(5) - int to INTEGER - bigint to NUMBER(19) - tinyint to NUMBER(3) - bit to NUMBER(1) - money to NUMBER(15, 4) - smallmoney to NUMBER(6, 4) - numeric to NUMBER - decimal to DECIMAL - real to BINARY_FLOAT - float to FLOAT - datetime to TIMESTAMP(or DATE for Oracle 8i) - smalldatetime to TIMESTAMP(or DATE for Oracle 8i) - XML to VARCHAR2 - timestamp(binary code) to VARCHAR2 - Sql_variant to VARCHAR2, or NUMBER etc. depending on the need - binary not supported - vbinary not supported - vbinarymax not supported - image not supported
6. Use alphanumeric aliases for SQL Server tables in Mapping.
Field separator for records in BCP output file. Enter ' ' (single quotes included) for using whitespace as field separator.
Record separator (end of a record) in BCP output file. Leave blank for default.

Use this option to create the work table in nologging mode (transaction is not written to redolog files). It's valid only for Oracle v8 and up and must be EMPTYfor Oracle v7. The default is NOLOGGING.

Directory where temporary files such as data and logs are created. This directory must be a valid path on the machine running the ODI Agent. If left BLANK (default), the JAVA temporary file directory will be used.
Examples: - On Windows: c:/temp - On Unix / Linux: /usr/tmp
Set this option to Yes to turn on Direct-Path Loading by SQLLDR
Enter the maximum number of records with errors allowed during loading.
Use this option to treat any relatively positioned columns that are not present in the record as null columns.
Set this option to No if you wish to retain temporary objects (tables, files and scripts) after integration.

Set this option to Yes to load data (export/import) in Unicode character format.
- The target Oracle database must support Unicode - Make sure column width is sufficient at target datastore for a column to hold Unicode content.

This option affects the use of PURGE key word and the way statistics are collected:
Values PURGE STATS 10 Yes DBMS_STATS 9 No DBMS_STATS 8 No ANALYZE
Please DATETIME_FORMAT option is correctly set without Fractional Seconds for Oracle 8i and older.

Use this option to map BCP exported fileds of SQL Server datetime and smalldatatime columns into Oracle TIMESTAMP (Oracle 9i and up) or DATE (for Oracle 8i and older) data.
- For Oracle 9i and up: The default is 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS.FF9' to convert to TIMESTAMP datatype. Always make sure Fractional Seconds format is specified.
- For Oracle 8i and older: Use 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS' to convert to DATE datatype. Please note a convresion of MS SQL Server datetime type to Oracle DATE type will result in the loss of fractonal seconds.
Refer to Oracle SQL Language Reference on TO_TIMESTAMP() and TO_DATE() functions.
Use this option to specify system path to BCP. Default is blank. E.g. C:\"Program Files"\"Microsoft SQL Server"\90\Tools\Binn\
Select True to connect to the default instance of local SQL Server. This is useful when a local SQL Server instance is not configured to accept TCP/IP calls.
Use this option to specify system path to SQLLDR. Default is blank. E.g. D:\"Oracle Home1"\product\11.1.0\db_1\BIN

Connect identifier for SQLLDR can be in the form of Net Service Name or Easy Connect (i.e. @[<net_service_name> | [//]Host[:Port]/<service_name>]). Leave blank to use Instance/dblink (Data Server) field of Physical Schema.
BCP out data to temporary bcp file

<?
package com.oracle.odi.km.ext;

public class sqlldrColFormat {

    public  static String get( String colName, srcDataType, destDataType, colFormat, colPrecision, colScale, colPos ) {
        String timestampFormat = "<%=odiRef.getOption("DATETIME_FORMAT")%>";
        String formating = " ";
        if (timestampFormat.trim().length()>0) {
            if (srcDataType.indexOf("TIMESTAMP")>-1) {    
                if (new Integer("<%=odiRef.getOption( "COMPATIBLE" )%>").intValue() < 9 ) 
                    formating +=    (char)34 + "TO_DATE(substr(:" + colName + ",1,15), "+ timestampFormat + ") " + (char)34;                
                else
                    formating +=   (char)34 + "TO_TIMESTAMP(:" + colName + ", "+ timestampFormat + ") " + (char)34;                
            }         
        } 

        return colName + formating;
    }

}

?>

OdiOutFile "-File=<?=getLKMOptions.getTempDir(\u0022<%=odiRef.getOption("DEFAULT_DIRECTORY")%>\u0022)?><?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>", "FILE")?>.ctl"
OPTIONS (
    ERRORS=<%=odiRef.getOption("LOA_ERRORS")%>,
    DIRECT=<%
if (odiRef.getOption("LOA_DIRECT").equals("0"))
   out.print("FALSE");
else
   out.print("TRUE");  
%>
    )
LOAD DATA
<%
if (odiRef.getOption("UNICODE_SUPPORT").equals("1"))
  out.print("CHARACTERSET  UTF16");
%>
INFILE         "<?=getLKMOptions.getTempDir(\u0022<%=odiRef.getOption("DEFAULT_DIRECTORY")%>\u0022)?><?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>", "FILE")?>.bcp" <% 
recordTerminator=odiRef.getOption("RECORD_SEPARATOR");
if (recordTerminator.length()>0) 
  out.print((char)34 +"STR '" +  recordTerminator + "'" +(char)34);
%> 
BADFILE     "<?=getLKMOptions.getTempDir(\u0022<%=odiRef.getOption("DEFAULT_DIRECTORY")%>\u0022)?><?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>", "FILE")?>.bad"
DISCARDFILE     "<?=getLKMOptions.getTempDir(\u0022<%=odiRef.getOption("DEFAULT_DIRECTORY")%>\u0022)?><?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>", "FILE")?>.dsc"
DISCARDMAX 1
INTO TABLE <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%>
<%
terminator=odiRef.getOption("FIELD_SEPARATOR");
 if (terminator.length()>0) {
     if (terminator.equals("' '"))
          out.print("FIELDS TERMINATED BY WHITESPACE  ");
       else
          out.print("FIELDS TERMINATED BY '" + terminator + "'");
}
%>
TRAILING NULLCOLS
(    
    <%=odiRef.getColList("", "\t"+
        "<?=sqlldrColFormat.get(\u0022[CX_COL_NAME]\u0022,\u0022[SOURCE_DT]\u0022, \u0022[DEST_DT]\u0022, \u0022[COL_FORMAT]\u0022, \u0022[LONGC]\u0022, \u0022[SCALE]\u0022, \u0022[BYTES]\u0022)?>"
    , ",\n\t", "","")%>
)

<?
package com.oracle.odi.km.ext;

public class getLKMOptions {

    public static String getTempDir(String dir) {
        String tempDir=dir;
        if (tempDir.length()<=0) 
          tempDir = System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir");
        if (!tempDir.endsWith("\") && !tempDir.endsWith("/"))
          tempDir += "/";
        return tempDir;
    }

    public static String getOdiFileDeleteOptions(String dir, String file, String drop) {
        if (!drop.equals("1"))
          return "";
        else 
          return "-DIR=" + getTempDir(dir) + " -FILE=" + file;;
    }

}
?>

OdiFileDelete <? 
dir = "<%=odiRef.getOption("DEFAULT_DIRECTORY")%>";
file = odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>", "FILE")+"*";
drop = "<%=odiRef.getOption("DELETE_TEMPORARY_OBJECTS")%>";
options = getLKMOptions.getOdiFileDeleteOptions(dir, file, drop) ;
out.print(options);
?> -RECURSE=no -CASESENS=no -NOFILE_ERROR=yes

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> update <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> set JRN_CONSUMED = '1' where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>

create view <%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_WORK_SCHEMA")%>.<?=odiRef.getFormattedName("<%=odiRef.getTableName("COLL_SHORT_NAME")%>V")?> as select <%=odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS")%> <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[EXPRESSION]\t[ALIAS_SEP] [CX_COL_NAME]", ",\n\t", "", "")%> from <%=odiRef.getFrom()%> where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getFilter()%> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <%=odiRef.getJoin()%> <%=odiRef.getGrpBy()%> <%=odiRef.getHaving()%>

<% if (new Integer(odiRef.getOption( "COMPATIBLE" )).intValue() < 9 ) { %>
analyze table <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%> estimate statistics
<% } else { %>
BEGIN DBMS_STATS.GATHER_TABLE_STATS ( ownname => '<%=odiRef.getInfo("DEST_WORK_SCHEMA")%>', tabname => '<%=odiRef.getTable("L","COLL_NAME","A").replaceAll("","").replaceAll("..>",".replaceAll(odiRef.getInfo( \\u0022DEST_WORK_SCHEMA\\u0022 )+\\u0022.\\u0022,\\u0022\\u0022)?>")%>', estimate_percent => DBMS_STATS.AUTO_SAMPLE_SIZE ); END;
<% }; %>

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> delete from <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> where JRN_CONSUMED = '1' <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>
DEMO.LKM MSSQL to Oracle (BCP-SQLLDR).Delete temporary files
DEMO.LKM MSSQL to Oracle (BCP-SQLLDR).Drop view on source
DEMO.LKM MSSQL to Oracle (BCP-SQLLDR).Drop work table
